    Transforming Covariates

    2017-11-14

    Supported transformations

    For convenience, you may wish to transform one or more of your covariates within the model estimation call. For example, imagine we want to natural log transform the variable dist in a linear regression:

    cars <- transform(cars, dist.log = log(dist))
    

    m.log <- lm(speed ~ log(dist), data = cars)
    

    m.log2 <- lm(speed ~ dist.log, data = cars)

    Then we want to find quantities of interest when the dist variable is 26 to 56 (the first to third quartile):

    
library(smargins)
    

    

    
summary(smargins(m.log, at = list(dist = c(26, 56))))
    ##   dist     mean        sd   median lower_2.5 upper_97.5
## 1   26 13.85991 0.4406185 13.85936  13.06201   14.73062
## 2   56 18.14312 0.5200652 18.12985  17.16147   19.24627

    We could also estimate the model with dist as a polynomial. For example:

    # Find range of polynomial values
    

    

    m2 <- lm(speed ~ poly(dist, 2), data = cars)
    

    
summary(smargins(m2, at = list(dist = with(cars, seq(min(dist), max(dist), 10)))))
    ##    dist     mean        sd   median lower_2.5 upper_97.5
## 1     2 12.83406 0.5147743 12.83187  11.82192   13.83419
## 2    12 13.53290 0.4635261 13.52363  12.63901   14.44493
## 3    22 14.16233 0.4401838 14.14598  13.33660   15.02027
## 4    32 14.72235 0.4349297 14.69482  13.92047   15.55516
## 5    42 15.21295 0.4377350 15.18361  14.39671   16.08094
## 6    52 15.63414 0.4413043 15.60746  14.81741   16.53239
## 7    62 15.98592 0.4419434 15.96458  15.17503   16.90464
## 8    72 16.26829 0.4394737 16.25195  15.42663   17.17818
## 9    82 16.48124 0.4372006 16.46537  15.64848   17.36546
## 10   92 16.62478 0.4419905 16.63619  15.78448   17.51084
## 11  102 16.69890 0.4635564 16.70858  15.78662   17.57445
## 12  112 16.70362 0.5117999 16.70678  15.66533   17.63568

    Splines and other transformations should generally work as expected.

    
library(splines)
    

    

    m3 <- lm(speed ~ bs(dist, df = 4), data = cars)
    

    
summary(smargins(m3, at = list(dist = with(cars, seq(min(dist), max(dist), 10)))))
    ##    dist      mean        sd    median  lower_2.5 upper_97.5
## 1     2  4.589114 2.2044552  4.658856  0.3918637   8.946315
## 2    12  7.256833 1.0960027  7.266843  5.2107761   9.528230
## 3    22 10.077134 0.6819740 10.046833  8.7046446  11.462554
## 4    32 12.855860 0.5237234 12.839343 11.8870872  13.908088
## 5    42 15.398854 0.5875729 15.422004 14.2420741  16.511196
## 6    52 17.511959 0.7393393 17.530283 16.0592889  18.941349
## 7    62 19.011819 0.7615866 19.024240 17.4840510  20.509163
## 8    72 19.963509 0.9303801 19.976623 18.0750442  21.711661
## 9    82 20.680535 1.2931401 20.628833 18.2125295  23.117647
## 10   92 21.487205 1.4635242 21.419439 18.6522282  24.276081
## 11  102 22.707826 1.5151251 22.675815 19.6551641  25.624572
## 12  112 24.666704 2.8315003 24.720761 18.9808669  30.212904
